questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator. You receive an email notification that you have reached 80 percent of your Dynamics 365 storage limit.
You perform the following actions to free up space:
✑ Delete known items that use large amount of storage.
✑ Perform bulk deletes on suspended system jobs.
Delete audit logs older than six months old.
//IMG//

✑ Delete email attachments older than two years old.
The total storage used indicator shows that the storage amount has not changed after you perform the actions.
You need to determine why the storage amount has not changed.
What is the cause?

choices.A: The current audit log cannot be deleted.
choices.C: The system can take up to 24 hours to update storage information.
choices.D: Suspended workflows are in a waiting state, therefore cannot be deleted.
choices.B: Email attachments can only be deleted when the associated email is deleted.

discussion.content: Reference link is very helpful for understanding the various types of storage usage and how you can reduce them. And it includes the Note text "After performing actions to free up storage, the system can take up to 24 hours to update storage information. We recommend waiting up to 24 hours and monitoring your storage.". Definitely the correct answer here.
Correct answer
In Exam
After performing actions to free up storage, the system can take up to 24 hours to update storage information. We recommend waiting up to 24 hours and monitoring your storage.
In exam

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You provide add-on components for Dynamics 365. The deployment requirements for many add-ons are different.
You need to ensure that you meet the deployment requirements for add-ons.
Which solution types should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate solution types to the correct requirements. Each solution type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:

discussion.content:
Clean Removal of Unwanted Solutions - Managed solution
Stop others from editing Intellectual Property - Managed solution
Edit the Solution directly - Unmanaged solution

Explanation:
- Deleting the Unmanaged Solution only deletes the reference to the solution, not the customisation components
- Managed Properties are useful to prevent clients from deleting or editing customisations
- You cannot Directly Edit the Components within a managed solution

Managed
Managed
Unmanaged

(1) Clean Removal of Unwanted Solutions - If you can actually remove it means is Unmanaged, right?
(2) Stop others from editing - Thats why managed solution existis
(3) Edit the solution directly - Unmanaged coz you CAN edit

1) Clean Removal of Unwanted Solution -- Clean Removal means no customization is lef behind when we remove the solution -- this is definitely Managed Solution

2) Stop others from editing Intellectual Property -- must be Managed Solution

3) Edit the Solution directly -- Unmanaged Solution
first one is None since its a remote access issue most Likely its a VPN problem

umanaged (coz it says unwanted solutions, not customization)
managed
unmanaged

Managed Solution
Managed Solution
Un-Managed Solution

Managed
Managed
Unmanaged

comments.content:
correct,
Managed, Managed Unmanaged

Typical exam question, ambiguous as ever! If "clean removal" means also removing the customizations associated with the solution, then Managed is definitely the right answer. I think this is what they are probably looking for here. If you assume "clean removal of unwanted solutions" simply means your customers can clean up their installed solutions list by deleting the solution, then unmanaged would be correct. But I think the implication of the "clean removal" is that it pulls out everything associate with the "unwanted solution". The implication is it's not just the solution file that's unwanted, but the whole solution contents.

Why should Clean removal of unwanted solutions be unmanaged?
To me it's Managed, Managed Unmanaged

discussion.content:
Above is wrong
Should be (obviously):
Clean Removal of Unwanted Solutions - Unmanaged 
Stop others from editing Intellectual Property - Managed
Edit the Solution directly- Unmanaged

comments.content: correct

Managed
Managed
Unmanaged

1. Clean removal means once you delete the solution, all the functionalities are taken out. So with that in mind, how is this unmanaged? 
2. Stop others from editing - It's common knowledge that Managed solutions cannot be edited, so...? 
3. Edit the solution directly - to edit a solution it has to be managed...

Soundharya...how did you come to these conclusions? Baffled.
No habbibi, you are wrong my habbibi
Not correct, take a look: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/solutions-overview
Above answers are Wrong

discussion.content:
Clean Removal of Unwanted Solutions - Unmanaged solutions
Stop others from editing Intellectual Property - Unmanaged solutions
Edit the Solution directly- Managed solutions

Managed Solution or Unmanaged Solution
Clean Removal of Unwanted Solutions 
Stop others from editing Intellectual Property
Edit the Solution directly

questions.question_text:
The sales team plans to create printed materials to be handed out each month during on-site visits with clients.
The materials must include client-specific information and statistics from Dynamics 365.
You need to ensure that sales team members can create the materials.
Which technology should you implement?

discussion.content: The answer is between word templates or Excel templates. Im more inclined towards word template because printing it the key requirement here.

comments.content: I guess word template is the correct answer here

yes, correct; had to read the question again but when I did, the choice between Word or Excel template is obvious. It has to be Word, to give the customer the printed sheet of info that relates only to them

discussion.content:
Word template guys
Because Excel Template is based on Views, so you wouldn't send to customer A, info from customer B.
Word Template can be generated from the entity form itself.
The materials must include "client-specific" information and statistics from Dynamics 365 --> client specific is the key to marketing list
Excel Template for me
Word template should be the answer. However, unsure what is MS considering for this exam!
word template as it is specific for a record whereas excel template is specific for a view. In word template aslso there is option to insert chart for showing statistics
word template

Excel template 
because you can include client specific information (client record specific) as well as statistics from D365 (eg pivottable/charts based on the opportunities or any related entity associated with client) in an excel template.The statistics cannot be done using word template
word template
In my exam, I choose the Word template

marketing list - but i’m not sure

in exam

what's the problem with Sales Literature ? in the question they are talking about sales team and printed material to be handed out which exactly matches the sales literature that stores sales-related information such as brochures or detailed specifications of products
Don't see the link here between marketing lists and printed material. Templates either work or excel make more sense...

I think it could be Sales Lierature
https://crmbook.powerobjects.com/basics/microsoft-dynamics-365-sales-process/working-with-microsoft-dynamics-crm-sales-literature/
opinions

comments.content:
sales literature can only be created against competitor and product.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/create-sales-literature

discussion.content:
I think its "Sales Literature"
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/create-sales-literature

comments.content: sales lit is for association with a competitor or a product. it wont have customer specific information only generic data.

discussion.content: Correct answer is Marketing List

comments.content: Marketing list just groups the 'recipients'. The question doesnt specify a specific group of recipients. You need to be able to create this print out for any client.

discussion.content: Question is asked regarding technology to be implemented here which is Marketing List. Marketing lists in Microsoft Dynamics 365 provide a way for you to group your accounts, contacts and leads so that you can market to specific segments more effectively. Marketing lists contain “members”—lead, contact, or account records—that meet a specific criteria or are managed manually by users.

comments.content:
Question is starting with "sales team plans to create printed materials to be handed out each month during on-site visits with clients." to be handed out
The materials must include client-specific information and statistics from Dynamics 365.
(we can design material with word template, so can be handed to client)

discussion.content: In examination
I think word template: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/create-quote-pdf
It's Marketing list. See; https://crmbook.powerobjects.com/basics/marketing/marketing-lists-dynamics-365/
in exam

Which is correct? As ROk gave the youtube URL for Excel template which also looks good (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKC7zyrSZtc), and the Word has Mail-merge functionality and as TobyN said Word Template can be generated from the entity form itself.
Marketing List and sales literature are ruled out. Now the BIG question is which one is correct? As per youtube video of Excel template, we could filter out the data for specific customer. Please suggest. 
Excel Template or Word Template ?

comments.content: Wprd Template

discussion.content: I vote for word template.
in exam

comments.content: Should be excel because of the word "statistics"

discussion.content:
Excel Template is the answer
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKC7zyrSZtc
Marketing list is used to segment the customers and use the mail-merge functionality using word templates to get the customer specific print.

I would absolutly vote for a Word Template. Here you are able to include date from different types of records including subrecords displayed in a table. But keep in mind that it is NOT all types of records that we can create a Word Template for.
Word Templates. The question does not ask for detailed/itemized statistical data of clients, so the option, excel templates seems to be out.

comments.content: True, but still how would you add 'statistics' about a single record in a Word Template? I guess you could add a table of child records (e.g. quotes)? That doesn't necessarily qualify as statistics though...
Word Template allows for a single record data (and related) to be included. Excel is used for multiple record analysis.

are you sure? It says "The materials must include client-specific information and statistics from Dynamics 365."

- "Statistics from from Dynamics 365"
Correct.

discussion.content:
"create printed materials to be handed out each month during on-site visits with clients"
To me it's clear that is or Excel or Word templates. I would go for Word in this one

Marketing lists are used to segment users according to business needs, generally for communication purposes. However, if you require to generate a printed document that includes data from Dynamics 365 you need to use Email templates.

comments.content: Email templates to print out and take a hard-copy? I highly doubt it.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service administrator.
You identify the following issues:
✑ Remote sales team members report that they cannot access the latest data on commuters, phones, and tablets.
✑ Help desk team members must be able to access all inbound emails from multiple queues in a single queue.
You need to resolve the issues.
Which options should you configure? To answer, drag the appropriate security methods to the correct teams. Each security method may be used once, more than once.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
I think it's
None (the users really need to access just D365)
Forward Mailbox (getting notifications from multiple mailboxes)

The right answers are :
1. Server-side synchronization , because they can not see updated data, which means they are not synchronized
2. Forward mailbox- because all Emails need to be in a single queue
2 Forward m

comments.content: Server side sync is only for email, contacts and activities.

discussion.content:
I know most Upvotes for Q1 - None, Q2 - Forward mailboxes.

First Paragraph in Reference: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/admin/server-side-synchronization 
indicates the answer for Q1 - by MS:
"Server-side synchronization is the preferred option for organizations with users who run Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) in a web browser or on a mobile device, such as a tablet or smartphone. "

I would go with the presented solution answers:
Q1- Remote sales team - SSS
Q2 - Help Desk Team - Forward mailboxes

For me the answer would be :

None
Forward Mailbox

Dynamics 365 for outlook
Server-side-sync
first one is None since its a remote access issue most Likely its a VPN problem

None
forward mailbox

1. Dynamics 365 for Outlook (assuming remote sales team would have outlook but no access to CRM dynamics)
2. Forward Mailbox
Was in my exam, I selected 1.Server-side and 2.Outlook
in exam

I Think Answer is 
None
Forward Mailbox
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/admin/server-side-synchronization
in exam
Can anybody find the right answer?

In my opinion the correct answers are:
- Server-side synchronization
- None
Why is the second answer forward mailbox?

comments.content: Because the requirement is "Help desk team members must be able to access all inbound emails from multiple queues in a single queue." Note here that they need all emails in a single queue, hence all inbound emails to be forwarded to a single queue.
May be "None"? That's why it's an option :D

Really hard to say for the remote sales team. Phones and Tablets might suggest they are using the mobile app and possibly offline? If they're using it offline then you can't really help them to get the latest data until they go back online so the answer would be none. But it also says on "commuters" (which I presume is a typo of "computers") alongside phones and tablets. If they're remote and can't get the latest info via a computer browser, I'm not sure what would help them!!! I'm not sure what the answer is and hope to not encounter this question on my exam!

discussion.content: So what is the correct answer?
Server side sync is only for email, contacts and activities. If the question is about all data in Dynamics 365, it should be Dynamics 365 Outlook App

comments.content: if app for outlook is installed then you can sync all dynamics data on several devices
make sense, however, not seeing the latest data in the phone, is not related to App for Outlook and not related to any other of these options...

questions.question_text:
An organization plans to create a hierarchy to categorize products and sales literature.
You need to implement subject trees to create the hierarchy.
What should you create?

discussion.content:
The Answer is A
B - is not appropriate because you can only have a single subject tree
C - is not appropriate because you can only have a single subject tree
D - is not appropriate because subject trees are not applicable to Teams

comments.content: Seems logical to me!

discussion.content:
https://flylib.com/books/en/3.159.1.21/1/
Answer is A
By creating a subject tree such as this one, you could link a product category, such as Road-150, with all its related Products, Cases, Sales Literature, and Knowledge Base Articles.
Was in my exam. A is the answer

Answer = B. Can you create a subject tree with a subject. You can refer (link) to a parent subject but that is not necessary if it is the top level) of your tree. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UKI9xi2_8cw

So you can make as many trees
what about option B ? in the question they are asking to implement subject treeS (plural) to create the hierarchy and it is possible to create hierarchies for separate entities.

Model-driven apps in Dynamics 365, such as Dynamics 365 Sales and Customer Service, include a subject organizational structure that lets you mark and categorize service cases, knowledge base articles, products, and sales literature. By using the subject hierarchy, you can classify service cases to quickly provide service to your customer. You can also provide the appropriate sales literature. You'll also be able to better understand gaps in your sales literature, evaluate service quality by subject area, and improve reporting on the performance of your product
In examination
in exam
in exam
in exam

choices.B: a subject tree for products and create a subject tree for sales literature
choices.D: a subject tree for sales team and customer service team
choices.A: a subject tree for organization to be used by products and sales literature
choices.C: a subject tree for sales and create a subject tree for customer service
